QUOTE: I've always been scared to death of pain - afraid, even, to think of it.
AUTHOR: Loretta Young

QUOTE: Policemen so cherish their status as keepers of the peace and protectors of the public that they have occasionally been known to beat to death those citizens or groups who question that status.
AUTHOR: David Mamet

QUOTE: At a certain age, death becomes familiar to you-or a loss becomes familiar-the tragedies that are more commonplace in life.
AUTHOR: Jessica Lange

QUOTE: Loved. You can't use it in the past tense. Death does not stop that love at all.
AUTHOR: Ken Kesey

QUOTE: Have an earnestness for death and you will have life.
AUTHOR: Abu Bakr

QUOTE: There is no harm in patience, and no profit in lamentation. Death is easier to bear (than) that which precedes it, and more severe than that which comes after it. Remember the death of the Apostle of God, and your sorrow will be lessened.
AUTHOR: Abu Bakr

QUOTE: You can cry about death and very properly so, your own as well as anybody else's. But it's inevitable, so you'd better grapple with it and cope and be aware that not only is it inevitable, but it has always been inevitable, if you see what I mean.
AUTHOR: David Attenborough

QUOTE: Sinful and forbidden pleasures are like poisoned bread they may satisfy appetite for the moment, but there is death in them at the end.
AUTHOR: Tryon Edwards

QUOTE: I'm very comfortable with the nature of life and death, and that we come to an end. What's most difficult to imagine is that those dreams and early yearnings and desires of childhood and adolescence will also disappear. But who knows? Maybe you become part of the eternal whatever.
AUTHOR: Hugh Hefner

QUOTE: If you make every game a life and death proposition, you're going to have problems. For one thing, you'll be dead a lot.
AUTHOR: Dean Smith

QUOTE: It's an incredible con job when you think about it, to believe something now in exchange for something after death. Even corporations with their reward systems don't try to make it posthumous.
AUTHOR: Gloria Steinem

QUOTE: Yes, people pull the trigger - but guns are the instrument of death. Gun control is necessary, and delay means more death and horror.
AUTHOR: Eliot Spitzer

QUOTE: Disease, insanity, and death were the angels that attended my cradle, and since then have followed me throughout my life.
AUTHOR: Edvard Munch

QUOTE: People always say that pregnant women have a glow. And I say it's because you're sweating to death.
AUTHOR: Jessica Simpson

QUOTE: The end of the animal trade would leave more time to trap or beat to death pop star wannabes.
AUTHOR: Simon Cowell

QUOTE: We are weak, writing is difficult, but for my own sake I do not regret this journey, which has shown that Englishmen can endure hardships, help one another, and meet death with as great a fortitude as ever in the past.
AUTHOR: Robert Falcon Scott

QUOTE: The sole equality on earth is death.
AUTHOR: Philip James Bailey

QUOTE: I put for the general inclination of all mankind, a perpetual and restless desire of power after power, that ceaseth only in death.
AUTHOR: Thomas Hobbes

QUOTE: Without fullness of experience, length of days is nothing. When fullness of life has been achieved, shortness of days is nothing. That is perhaps why the young have usually so little fear of death they live by intensities that the elderly have forgotten.
AUTHOR: Lewis Mumford

QUOTE: I intend to leave after my death a large fund for the promotion of the peace idea, but I am skeptical as to its results.
AUTHOR: Alfred Nobel

QUOTE: Sleep is lovely, death is better still, not to have been born is of course the miracle.
AUTHOR: Heinrich Heine

QUOTE: Life isn't fair. It's just fairer than death, that's all.
AUTHOR: William Goldman

QUOTE: I feel like I don't watch that many shows with death.
AUTHOR: Lena Dunham

QUOTE: Consciousness after death demonstrates the possibility of consciousness operating independently of the body.
AUTHOR: Stanislav Grof

QUOTE: Whenever I watch TV and see those poor starving kids all over the world, I can't help but cry. I mean I'd love to be skinny like that, but not with all those flies and death and stuff.
AUTHOR: Mariah Carey

QUOTE: When applied to politics and taken to its extreme, kitsch is the mask of death. Fascism was all aesthetics. There was no core principle to it. There was no truth to it.
AUTHOR: John Cusack

QUOTE: All interest in disease and death is only another expression of interest in life.
AUTHOR: Thomas Mann

QUOTE: I love this pedal to death. The only way you could keep me from playing one is by chopping off my legs!
AUTHOR: Kirk Hammett

QUOTE: Even when you're making a movie about life, death is a presence, and I guess it's part of my dramatic viewpoint. I'm not sure why exactly. Maybe I'm drawn to it as a story element.
AUTHOR: Gus Van Sant

QUOTE: Once a disease has entered the body, all parts which are healthy must fight it: not one alone, but all. Because a disease might mean their common death. Nature knows this and Nature attacks the disease with whatever help she can muster.
AUTHOR: Paracelsus

QUOTE: People can undergo a sudden change of thinking and loyalties under threat of death or intense social pressure and isolation from friends and family.
AUTHOR: Keith Henson

QUOTE: It's not the normal way to look at things but I experienced death at a really young age and because of that it's been part of my mental landscape that death is really very possible.
AUTHOR: Cate Blanchett

QUOTE: I made a supreme effort not to do that thing that parents do, which is to bore people without children to death by going on and on about how funny their children are, so there's none of that hopefully.
AUTHOR: Jo Brand

QUOTE: Courage is the art of being the only one who knows you're scared to death.
AUTHOR: Earl Wilson

QUOTE: Death, the final, triumphant lover.
AUTHOR: Bela Lugosi

QUOTE: I believe that people would be alive today if there were a death penalty.
AUTHOR: Nancy Reagan

QUOTE: For three days after death, hair and fingernails continue to grow but phone calls taper off.
AUTHOR: Johnny Carson

QUOTE: My brother was a great favorite with everybody, and his death cast a gloom upon the whole neighborhood.
AUTHOR: Buffalo Bill

QUOTE: So for twelve miles I rode with Sherman, and we became fast friends. He asked me all manner of questions on the way, and I found that he knew my father well, and remembered his tragic death in Salt Creek Valley.
AUTHOR: Buffalo Bill

QUOTE: Tears are sometimes an inappropriate response to death. When a life has been lived completely honestly, completely successfully, or just completely, the correct response to death's perfect punctuation mark is a smile.
AUTHOR: Julie Burchill

QUOTE: Life can't defeat a writer who is in love with writing, for life itself is a writer's lover until death.
AUTHOR: Edna Ferber

QUOTE: But I am delighted to be a Dodger, I grew up a Dodger fan and now my dreams have really come true.
AUTHOR: Milton Bradley

QUOTE: Don't be afraid of your dreams.
AUTHOR: Jacques Parizeau

QUOTE: Tell me about yourself - your struggles, your dreams, your telephone number.
AUTHOR: Peter Arno

QUOTE: When your dreams tire, they go underground and out of kindness that's where they stay.
AUTHOR: Libby Houston

QUOTE: I'll see you in my dreams.
AUTHOR: Gus Kahn

QUOTE: There are no dreams too large, no innovation unimaginable and no frontiers beyond our reach.
AUTHOR: John S. Herrington

QUOTE: I would go to bed every night and have dreams about having a time machine and somehow I'd have the ability to move through time and space freely, and save Anne Frank.
AUTHOR: Jeff Mangum

QUOTE: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: The only thing that interferes with my learning is my education.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: My mother said I must always be intolerant of ignorance but understanding of illiteracy. That some people, unable to go to school, were more educated and more intelligent than college professors.
AUTHOR: Maya Angelou

QUOTE: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: In the first place, God made idiots. That was for practice. Then he made school boards.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.
AUTHOR: Robert Frost

QUOTE: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: An education isn't how much you have committed to memory, or even how much you know. It's being able to differentiate between what you know and what you don't.
AUTHOR: Anatole France

QUOTE: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire.
AUTHOR: William Butler Yeats

QUOTE: Develop a passion for learning. If you do, you will never cease to grow.
AUTHOR: Anthony J. D'Angelo

QUOTE: Education is the key to unlock the golden door of freedom.
AUTHOR: George Washington Carver

QUOTE: Education is the best friend. An educated person is respected everywhere. Education beats the beauty and the youth.
AUTHOR: Chanakya

QUOTE: A liberal education is at the heart of a civil society, and at the heart of a liberal education is the act of teaching.
AUTHOR: A. Bartlett Giamatti

QUOTE: It is a thousand times better to have common sense without education than to have education without common sense.
AUTHOR: Robert Green Ingersoll

QUOTE: I spent three days a week for 10 years educating myself in the public library, and it's better than college. People should educate themselves - you can get a complete education for no money. At the end of 10 years, I had read every book in the library and I'd written a thousand stories.
AUTHOR: Ray Bradbury

QUOTE: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
AUTHOR: Victor Hugo

QUOTE: The only person who is educated is the one who has learned how to learn and change.
AUTHOR: Carl Rogers

QUOTE: Education is not preparation for life education is life itself.
AUTHOR: John Dewey

QUOTE: The goal of education is the advancement of knowledge and the dissemination of truth.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: Education is a progressive discovery of our own ignorance.
AUTHOR: Will Durant

QUOTE: The doer alone learneth.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: A human being is not attaining his full heights until he is educated.
AUTHOR: Horace Mann

QUOTE: Education doesn't change life much. It just lifts trouble to a higher plane of regard.
AUTHOR: Robert Frost

QUOTE: Don't limit a child to your own learning, for he was born in another time.
AUTHOR: Rabindranath Tagore

QUOTE: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
AUTHOR: Walt Disney

QUOTE: No one has yet realized the wealth of sympathy, the kindness and generosity hidden in the soul of a child. The effort of every true education should be to unlock that treasure.
AUTHOR: Emma Goldman

QUOTE: Change is the end result of all true learning.
AUTHOR: Leo Buscaglia

QUOTE: America is becoming so educated that ignorance will be a novelty. I will belong to the select few.
AUTHOR: Will Rogers

QUOTE: Why should society feel responsible only for the education of children, and not for the education of all adults of every age?
AUTHOR: Erich Fromm

QUOTE: The direction in which education starts a man will determine his future in life.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Education is a better safeguard of liberty than a standing army.
AUTHOR: Edward Everett

QUOTE: The more that learn to read the less learn how to make a living. That's one thing about a little education. It spoils you for actual work. The more you know the more you think somebody owes you a living.
AUTHOR: Will Rogers

QUOTE: Education's purpose is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
AUTHOR: Malcolm Forbes

QUOTE: Data is not information, information is not knowledge, knowledge is not understanding, understanding is not wisdom.
AUTHOR: Clifford Stoll

QUOTE: An educated person is one who has learned that information almost always turns out to be at best incomplete and very often false, misleading, fictitious, mendacious - just dead wrong.
AUTHOR: Russell Baker

QUOTE: The illiterate of the future will not be the person who cannot read. It will be the person who does not know how to learn.
AUTHOR: Alvin Toffler

QUOTE: Much education today is monumentally ineffective. All too often we are giving young people cut flowers when we should be teaching them to grow their own plants.
AUTHOR: John W. Gardner

QUOTE: Education is simply the soul of a society as it passes from one generation to another.
AUTHOR: Gilbert K. Chesterton

QUOTE: Children have to be educated, but they have also to be left to educate themselves.
AUTHOR: Ernest Dimnet

QUOTE: I am often amazed at how much more capability and enthusiasm for science there is among elementary school youngsters than among college students.
AUTHOR: Carl Sagan

QUOTE: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning to sail my ship.
AUTHOR: Aeschylus

QUOTE: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books.
AUTHOR: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

QUOTE: Some people will never learn anything, for this reason, because they understand everything too soon.
AUTHOR: Alexander Pope

QUOTE: Education, n.: That which discloses to the wise and disguises from the foolish their lack of understanding.
AUTHOR: Ambrose Bierce

QUOTE: No man who worships education has got the best out of education... Without a gentle contempt for education no man's education is complete.
AUTHOR: Gilbert K. Chesterton

QUOTE: Education is learning what you didn't even know you didn't know.
AUTHOR: Daniel J. Boorstin

QUOTE: Learn to think continentally.
AUTHOR: Alexander Hamilton

QUOTE: Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and diligence.
AUTHOR: Abigail Adams

QUOTE: Learning, n. The kind of ignorance distinguishing the studious.
AUTHOR: Ambrose Bierce

QUOTE: An educated man is thoroughly inoculated against humbug, thinks for himself and tries to give his thoughts, in speech or on paper, some style.
AUTHOR: Alan K. Simpson

QUOTE: When I get a little money I buy books and if any is left I buy food and clothes.
AUTHOR: Desiderius Erasmus

QUOTE: When a subject becomes totally obsolete we make it a required course.
AUTHOR: Peter Drucker

QUOTE: To the uneducated, an A is just three sticks.
AUTHOR: A. A. Milne

QUOTE: The whole purpose of education is to turn mirrors into windows.
AUTHOR: Sydney J. Harris

QUOTE: Poor people cannot rely on the government to come to help you in times of need. You have to get your education. Then nobody can control your destiny.
AUTHOR: Charles Barkley

QUOTE: Education is what survives when what has been learned has been forgotten.
AUTHOR: B. F. Skinner

QUOTE: Good teaching is one-fourth preparation and three-fourths pure theatre.
AUTHOR: Gail Godwin

QUOTE: Education is all a matter of building bridges.
AUTHOR: Ralph Ellison

QUOTE: The object of education is to prepare the young to educate themselves throughout their lives.
AUTHOR: Robert M. Hutchins

QUOTE: Some people drink from the fountain of knowledge, others just gargle.
AUTHOR: Robert Anthony

QUOTE: I prefer the company of peasants because they have not been educated sufficiently to reason incorrectly.
AUTHOR: Michel de Montaigne

QUOTE: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow the advice of Plato and start with mathematics.
AUTHOR: Galileo Galilei

QUOTE: The great difficulty in education is to get experience out of ideas.
AUTHOR: George Santayana

QUOTE: An educated people can be easily governed.
AUTHOR: Frederick The Great

QUOTE: Learning is a result of listening, which in turn leads to even better listening and attentiveness to the other person. In other words, to learn from the child, we must have empathy, and empathy grows as we learn.
AUTHOR: Alice Miller

QUOTE: I think everyone should go to college and get a degree and then spend six months as a bartender and six months as a cabdriver. Then they would really be educated.
AUTHOR: Al McGuire

QUOTE: Education is the transmission of civilization.
AUTHOR: Will Durant

QUOTE: If the education of our kids comes from radio, television, newspapers - if that's where they get most of their knowledge from, and not from the schools, then the powers that be are definitely in charge, because they own all those outlets.
AUTHOR: Maynard James Keenan

QUOTE: Your library is your paradise.
AUTHOR: Desiderius Erasmus

QUOTE: If the Romans had been obliged to learn Latin, they would never have found time to conquer the world.
AUTHOR: Heinrich Heine

QUOTE: The only real failure in life is one not learned from.
AUTHOR: Anthony J. D'Angelo

QUOTE: He who studies books alone will know how things ought to be, and he who studies men will know how they are.
AUTHOR: Charles Caleb Colton

QUOTE: It is with children that we have the best chance of studying the development of logical knowledge, mathematical knowledge, physical knowledge, and so forth.
AUTHOR: Jean Piaget

QUOTE: America is the best half-educated country in the world.
AUTHOR: Nicholas M. Butler

QUOTE: I read Shakespeare and the Bible, and I can shoot dice. That's what I call a liberal education.
AUTHOR: Tallulah Bankhead

QUOTE: It is always in season for old men to learn.
AUTHOR: Aeschylus

QUOTE: Education... has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading.
AUTHOR: G. M. Trevelyan

QUOTE: If an ignorant person is attracted by the things of the world, that is bad. But if a learned person is thus attracted, it is worse.
AUTHOR: Abu Bakr

QUOTE: True, a little learning is a dangerous thing, but it still beats total ignorance.
AUTHOR: Abigail Van Buren

QUOTE: It is only as we develop others that we permanently succeed.
AUTHOR: Harvey S. Firestone

QUOTE: Responsibility educates.
AUTHOR: Wendell Phillips

QUOTE: I would like to learn, or remember, how to live.
AUTHOR: Annie Dillard

QUOTE: Real education must ultimately be limited to men who insist on knowing, the rest is mere sheep-herding.
AUTHOR: Ezra Pound

QUOTE: It has been said that 80% of what people learn is visual.
AUTHOR: Allen Klein

QUOTE: Men and women must be educated, in a great degree, by the opinions and manners of the society they live in.
AUTHOR: Mary Wollstonecraft

QUOTE: I learned more stuff in church than I did in the world.
AUTHOR: Al Green

QUOTE: The willingness to learn new skills is very high.
AUTHOR: Angela Merkel

QUOTE: To the extent that we are all educated and informed, we will be more equipped to deal with the gut issues that tend to divide us.
AUTHOR: Caroline Kennedy Schlossberg

QUOTE: If I had learned education I would not have had time to learn anything else.
AUTHOR: Cornelius Vanderbilt

QUOTE: Man is what he reads.
AUTHOR: Joseph Brodsky

QUOTE: You can educate yourself right out of a relationship with God.
AUTHOR: Tammy Faye Bakker

QUOTE: The simplest schoolboy is now familiar with truths for which Archimedes would have sacrificed his life.
AUTHOR: Ernest Renan

QUOTE: I know a lot of people think I'm dumb. Well, at least I ain't no educated fool.
AUTHOR: Leon Spinks

QUOTE: Every educated person is a future enemy.
AUTHOR: Martin Bormann

QUOTE: It is well to read everything of something, and something of everything.
AUTHOR: Joseph Brodsky

QUOTE: To me education is a leading out of what is already there in the pupil's soul. To Miss Mackay it is a putting in of something that is not there, and that is not what I call education. I call it intrusion.

QUOTE: Our universities and museums are respected around the country.
AUTHOR: Jane Byrne

QUOTE: I am sure my fellow-scientists will agree with me if I say that whatever we were able to achieve in our later years had its origin in the experiences of our youth and in the hopes and wishes which were formed before and during our time as students.
AUTHOR: Felix Bloch

QUOTE: The function of education is to teach one to think intensively and to think critically. Intelligence plus character - that is the goal of true education.
AUTHOR: Martin Luther King, Jr.

QUOTE: The purpose of education is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
AUTHOR: Malcolm Forbes

QUOTE: Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: My mother was the most beautiful woman I ever saw. All I am I owe to my mother. I attribute all my success in life to the moral, intellectual and physical education I received from her.
AUTHOR: George Washington

QUOTE: Formal education will make you a living self-education will make you a fortune.
AUTHOR: Jim Rohn

QUOTE: It is a miracle that curiosity survives formal education.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not nothing is more common than unsuccessful people with talent. Genius will not unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not the world is full of educated failures. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent.
AUTHOR: Calvin Coolidge

QUOTE: Education without values, as useful as it is, seems rather to make man a more clever devil.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: A thorough knowledge of the Bible is worth more than a college education.
AUTHOR: Theodore Roosevelt

QUOTE: Don't let schooling interfere with your education.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: I've never let my school interfere with my education.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Cauliflower is nothing but cabbage with a college education.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: I have always had this view about the modern education system: we pay attention to brain development, but the development of warmheartedness we take for granted.
AUTHOR: Dalai Lama

QUOTE: Democracy cannot succeed unless those who express their choice are prepared to choose wisely. The real safeguard of democracy, therefore, is education.
AUTHOR: Franklin D. Roosevelt

QUOTE: Education consists mainly of what we have unlearned.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Education is the passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.
AUTHOR: Malcolm X

QUOTE: I never let schooling interfere with my education.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Soap and education are not as sudden as a massacre, but they are more deadly in the long run.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: There is no end to education. It is not that you read a book, pass an examination, and finish with education. The whole of life, from the moment you are born to the moment you die, is a process of learning.

QUOTE: Anyone who knows history, particularly the history of Europe, will, I think, recognize that the domination of education or of government by any one particular religious faith is never a happy arrangement for the people.

QUOTE: No part of the education of a politician is more indispensable than the fighting of elections.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: The highest result of education is tolerance.

QUOTE: To penetrate and dissipate these clouds of darkness, the general mind must be strengthened by education.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: The giving of love is an education in itself.

QUOTE: A fool's brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.

QUOTE: Purity of personal life is the one indispensable condition for building up a sound education.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: Do you know the difference between education and experience? Education is when you read the fine print experience is what you get when you don't.

QUOTE: Our progress as a nation can be no swifter than our progress in education. The human mind is our fundamental resource.

QUOTE: Education is an ornament in prosperity and a refuge in adversity.

QUOTE: Genius without education is like silver in the mine.

QUOTE: If someone is going down the wrong road, he doesn't need motivation to speed him up. What he needs is education to turn him around.

QUOTE: Sex education may be a good idea in the schools, but I don't believe the kids should be given homework.

QUOTE: It might be said now that I have the best of both worlds. A Harvard education and a Yale degree.

QUOTE: Music is the movement of sound to reach the soul for the education of its virtue.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: A man who has never gone to school may steal from a freight car but if he has a university education, he may steal the whole railroad.

QUOTE: If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.

QUOTE: Education is the best provision for old age.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: We have an obligation and a responsibility to be investing in our students and our schools. We must make sure that people who have the grades, the desire and the will, but not the money, can still get the best education possible.
AUTHOR: Barack Obama

QUOTE: In large states public education will always be mediocre, for the same reason that in large kitchens the cooking is usually bad.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: Education comes from within you get it by struggle and effort and thought.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Hill

QUOTE: Education is hanging around until you've caught on.
AUTHOR: Robert Frost

QUOTE: No man should bring children into the world who is unwilling to persevere to the end in their nature and education.

QUOTE: I had a terrible education. I attended a school for emotionally disturbed teachers.

QUOTE: Cutting the deficit by gutting our investments in innovation and education is like lightening an overloaded airplane by removing its engine. It may make you feel like you're flying high at first, but it won't take long before you feel the impact.

AUTHOR: Michelle Obama

QUOTE: The most important part of education is proper training in the nursery.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Men are born ignorant, not stupid. They are made stupid by education.
AUTHOR: Bertrand Russell

QUOTE: I cannot understand how the education of this United States of America has been fooled time and time again. Either make it separate but equal or integrate, therefore it will be equal. And it has been separate and unequal.

QUOTE: The highest education is that which does not merely give us information but makes our life in harmony with all existence.
AUTHOR: Rabindranath Tagore

QUOTE: If a man neglects education, he walks lame to the end of his life.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: There's only one thing that can kill the movies, and that's education.
AUTHOR: Will Rogers

QUOTE: The greatest education in the world is watching the masters at work.
AUTHOR: Michael Jackson

QUOTE: Attitude is more important than the past, than education, than money, than circumstances, than what people do or say. It is more important than appearance, giftedness, or skill.
AUTHOR: Charles R. Swindoll

QUOTE: For good nurture and education implant good constitutions.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Natural ability without education has more often raised a man to glory and virtue than education without natural ability.
AUTHOR: Marcus Aurelius

QUOTE: You can choose a future where more Americans have the chance to gain the skills they need to compete, no matter how old they are or how much money they have. Education was the gateway to opportunity for me. It was the gateway for Michelle. And now more than ever, it is the gateway to a middle-class life.
AUTHOR: Barack Obama

QUOTE: Education is a weapon whose effects depend on who holds it in his hands and at whom it is aimed.
AUTHOR: Joseph Stalin

QUOTE: We can't get to the $4 trillion in savings that we need by just cutting the 12 percent of the budget that pays for things like medical research and education funding and food inspectors and the weather service. And we can't just do it by making seniors pay more for Medicare.
AUTHOR: Barack Obama

QUOTE: Nature has always had more force than education.
AUTHOR: Voltaire

QUOTE: Academic qualifications are important and so is financial education. They're both important and schools are forgetting one of them.
AUTHOR: Robert Kiyosaki

QUOTE: Give a girl an education and introduce her properly into the world, and ten to one but she has the means of settling well, without further expense to anybody.
AUTHOR: Jane Austen

QUOTE: Talk is by far the most accessible of pleasures. It costs nothing in money, it is all profit, it completes our education, founds and fosters our friendships, and can be enjoyed at any age and in almost any state of health.
AUTHOR: Robert Louis Stevenson

QUOTE: To accuse others for one's own misfortunes is a sign of want of education. To accuse oneself shows that one's education has begun. To accuse neither oneself nor others shows that one's education is complete.
AUTHOR: Epictetus

QUOTE: Education is the investment our generation makes in the future.
AUTHOR: Mitt Romney

QUOTE: The Church is not a gallery for the exhibition of eminent Christians, but a school for the education of imperfect ones.
AUTHOR: Henry Ward Beecher

QUOTE: The American culture promotes personal responsibility, the dignity of work, the value of education, the merit of service, devotion to a purpose greater than self, and at the foundation, the pre-eminence of family.
AUTHOR: Mitt Romney

QUOTE: What have I got? No looks, no money, no education. Just talent.
AUTHOR: Sammy Davis, Jr.

QUOTE: We are faced with the paradoxical fact that education has become one of the chief obstacles to intelligence and freedom of thought.
AUTHOR: Bertrand Russell

QUOTE: Opportunity expands when there is excellence and choice in education, when taxes are lowered, when every citizen has affordable, portable health insurance and when constitutional freedoms are preserved.
AUTHOR: Mitt Romney

QUOTE: I am running for president to help create a better future. A future where everyone who wants a job can find one. Where no senior fears for the security of their retirement. An America where every parent knows that their child will get an education that leads them to a good job and a bright horizon.
AUTHOR: Mitt Romney

QUOTE: The most valuable of all education is the ability to make yourself do the thing you have to do, when it has to be done, whether you like it or not.
AUTHOR: Aldous Huxley

QUOTE: There are 4 billion cell phones in use today. Many of them are in the hands of market vendors, rickshaw drivers, and others who've historically lacked access to education and opportunity. Information networks have become a great leveler, and we should use them together to help lift people out of poverty and give them a freedom from want.
AUTHOR: Hillary Clinton

QUOTE: Self-education is, I firmly believe, the only kind of education there is.
AUTHOR: Isaac Asimov

QUOTE: As people do better, they start voting like Republicans - unless they have too much education and vote Democratic, which proves there can be too much of a good thing.
AUTHOR: Karl Rove

QUOTE: Knowledge is power. Information is liberating. Education is the premise of progress, in every society, in every family.
AUTHOR: Kofi Annan

QUOTE: No group and no government can properly prescribe precisely what should constitute the body of knowledge with which true education is concerned.
AUTHOR: Franklin D. Roosevelt

QUOTE: Common sense is in spite of, not as the result of education.
AUTHOR: Victor Hugo

QUOTE: The aim of a college education is to teach you to know a good man when you see one.
AUTHOR: William James

QUOTE: Let's not leave an educational vacuum to be filled by religious extremists who go to families who have no other option and offer meals, housing and some form of education. If we are going to combat extremism then we must educate those very same children.
AUTHOR: Hillary Clinton

QUOTE: Travel, in the younger sort, is a part of education in the elder, a part of experience.
AUTHOR: Francis Bacon

QUOTE: Without education, you are not going anywhere in this world.
AUTHOR: Malcolm X

QUOTE: Education is that whole system of human training within and without the school house walls, which molds and develops men.
AUTHOR: W. E. B. Du Bois

QUOTE: At the bottom of education, at the bottom of politics, even at the bottom of religion, there must be for our race economic independence.
AUTHOR: Booker T. Washington

QUOTE: If you know how to read, you have a complete education about life, then you know how to vote within a democracy. But if you don't know how to read, you don't know how to decide. That's the great thing about our country - we're a democracy of readers, and we should keep it that way.
AUTHOR: Ray Bradbury

QUOTE: I feel very lucky because of my parents and then my education, the opportunities that I've had, so I would like to continue working to improve lives for others.
AUTHOR: Hillary Clinton

QUOTE: America believes in education: the average professor earns more money in a year than a professional athlete earns in a whole week.
AUTHOR: Evan Esar

QUOTE: The aim of education is the knowledge not of facts but of values.
AUTHOR: William Ralph Inge

QUOTE: An unschooled man who knows how to meditate upon the Lord has learned far more than the man with the highest education who does not know how to meditate.
AUTHOR: Charles Stanley

QUOTE: I doubt whether classical education ever has been or can be successfully carried out without corporal punishment.
AUTHOR: George Orwell

QUOTE: Education is the cheap defense of nations.
AUTHOR: Edmund Burke

QUOTE: Too much of what is called 'education' is little more than an expensive isolation from reality.
AUTHOR: Thomas Sowell

QUOTE: I add this, that rational ability without education has oftener raised man to glory and virtue, than education without natural ability.
AUTHOR: Marcus Tullius Cicero

QUOTE: The ultimate goal of the educational system is to shift to the individual the burden of pursing his own education. This will not be a widely shared pursuit until we get over our odd conviction that education is what goes on in school buildings and nowhere else.
AUTHOR: John W. Gardner

QUOTE: Establishing lasting peace is the work of education all politics can do is keep us out of war.
AUTHOR: Maria Montessori

QUOTE: Education is the period during which you are being instructed by somebody you do not know, about something you do not want to know.
AUTHOR: Gilbert K. Chesterton

QUOTE: The paradox of education is precisely this - that as one begins to become conscious one begins to examine the society in which he is being educated.
AUTHOR: James A. Baldwin

QUOTE: His lack of education is more than compensated for by his keenly developed moral bankruptcy.
AUTHOR: Woody Allen

QUOTE: Education begins the gentleman, but reading, good company and reflection must finish him.
AUTHOR: John Locke

QUOTE: The purpose of Compulsory Education is to deprive the common people of their commonsense.
AUTHOR: Gilbert K. Chesterton

QUOTE: Without education we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.
AUTHOR: Gilbert K. Chesterton

QUOTE: Game shows are designed to make us feel better about the random, useless facts that are all we have left of our education.
AUTHOR: Chuck Palahniuk

QUOTE: There is no education like adversity.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: To read a newspaper is to refrain from reading something worth while. The first discipline of education must therefore be to refuse resolutely to feed the mind with canned chatter.
AUTHOR: Aleister Crowley

QUOTE: The first duty of government is to see that people have food, fuel, and clothes. The second, that they have means of moral and intellectual education.
AUTHOR: John Ruskin

QUOTE: Whenever a youth is ascertained to possess talents meriting an education which his parents cannot afford, he should be carried forward at the public expense.
AUTHOR: James Madison

QUOTE: Natural ability without education has more often attained to glory and virtue than education without natural ability.
AUTHOR: Marcus Tullius Cicero

QUOTE: Upon books the collective education of the race depends they are the sole instruments of registering, perpetuating and transmitting thought.
AUTHOR: Harry S. Truman

QUOTE: Frivolity is inborn, conceit acquired by education.
AUTHOR: Marcus Tullius Cicero

QUOTE: Education must provide the opportunities for self-fulfillment it can at best provide a rich and challenging environment for the individual to explore, in his own way.
AUTHOR: Noam Chomsky

QUOTE: If education is always to be conceived along the same antiquated lines of a mere transmission of knowledge, there is little to be hoped from it in the bettering of man's future. For what is the use of transmitting knowledge if the individual's total development lags behind?
AUTHOR: Maria Montessori

QUOTE: To make your children capable of honesty is the beginning of education.
AUTHOR: John Ruskin

QUOTE: Education then, beyond all other devices of human origin, is the great equalizer of the conditions of men, the balance-wheel of the social machinery.
AUTHOR: Horace Mann

QUOTE: Upon the education of the people of this country the fate of this country depends.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: We are born weak, we need strength helpless, we need aid foolish, we need reason. All that we lack at birth, all that we need when we come to man's estate, is the gift of education.
AUTHOR: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

QUOTE: Apply yourself. Get all the education you can, but then, by God, do something. Don't just stand there, make it happen.
AUTHOR: Lee Iacocca

QUOTE: The education of a man is never completed until he dies.
AUTHOR: Robert E. Lee

QUOTE: Education is the leading of human souls to what is best, and making what is best out of them.
AUTHOR: John Ruskin

QUOTE: You know, nothing is more important than education, because nowhere are our stakes higher our future depends on the quality of education of our children today.

QUOTE: Well, my personal mission statement is that we want marriage equality in all 50 states. We want it not to be a state-by-state issue. We don't want it to be something the majority is voting on. I don't think the civil rights of any minority should be in the hands of any majority.

QUOTE: As an actor, you just want to work, and then you just want to be on a show or have a job that you love, and you hope that job will last - those things have happened. To have that platform to then talk about something that is very personal to me like marriage equality, it feels like a gift. I try and really respect that voice and not abuse it.
AUTHOR: Jesse Tyler Ferguson

QUOTE: And think of how we challenged the idea of a male dominated Parliament with All-Women shortlists and made the cause of gender equality central to our government. We were right to do so.
AUTHOR: Ed Miliband

QUOTE: Scotland is my country, the nation that shaped me, that taught me my values. A nation whose achievements inspired and inspire me, a community whose failings drive me - drive my overwhelming desire to fight for social justice and equality.
AUTHOR: Johann Lamont

QUOTE: There needs to be radical development in equality law to create the environment to allow women to stay in work.
AUTHOR: Ken Livingstone

QUOTE: As a partner in a firm full of women who work outside of the home as well as stay at home mothers, all with plenty of children, gender equality is not a talking point for me. It is an issue I live every day.
AUTHOR: Hilary Rosen

QUOTE: I said on the equality side of it, that it is essential to a woman's equality with man that she be the decision-maker, that her choice be controlling.
AUTHOR: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

QUOTE: Earlier feminists were almost universally pro-choice and have dominated political debate until now. Having access to abortion was viewed as the only way women could have full equality with men, who, until recently, couldn't get pregnant.
AUTHOR: Kathleen Parker

QUOTE: A formally recognized equality does, however, accord the smaller nations a position which they should be able to use increasingly in the interest of humanity as a whole and in the service of the ideal.
AUTHOR: Hjalmar Branting

QUOTE: The equality among all members of the League, which is provided in the statutes giving each state only one vote, cannot of course abolish the actual material inequality of the powers concerned.
AUTHOR: Hjalmar Branting

QUOTE: It wouldn't be fair to say that conservatives cherish property the way liberals cherish equality. But it would be fair to say that the takings clause is the conservatives' recipe for judicial activism just as they say liberals have misused the equal protection clause.
AUTHOR: Michael Kinsley

QUOTE: We are also further than ever from equality of opportunity.
AUTHOR: Ferdinand Mount

QUOTE: Equality of rights means that some people cannot simply impose obligations on others, for the moral agency and rights of those others would then be violated.
AUTHOR: Tom G. Palmer

QUOTE: As a result of America's efforts to realize the ideals of equality and freedom, blacks in America are now the freest and richest black people anywhere on the face of the earth including all of the nations that are ruled by blacks.
AUTHOR: David Horowitz

QUOTE: Women have talent and intelligence but, due to social constraints and prejudices, it is still a long distance away from the goal of gender equality.
AUTHOR: Pratibha Patil

QUOTE: I think men are allowed to be fat and bald and ugly and women aren't. And it's just not - there is no equality there.
AUTHOR: Connie Chung

QUOTE: Everybody thinks that equality comes from identifying people, and that's not where equality comes from.
AUTHOR: Matt Bomer

QUOTE: You got to fight for quality art and equality and all the things that we're fighting for, the things we believe in. Choice and preference and all those things that we support. We don't want to give up that fight. You got to keep doing it.
AUTHOR: Christopher Cross

QUOTE: I joined the Labour party because I believed in equality, in freedom of speech and in tolerance, compassion and understanding for people, irrespective of their background and views. In whatever I decide to do in the future I will hold to those principles.
AUTHOR: Geoff Hoon

QUOTE: Obviously, my life and my job in 2010 is very different from Peggy's experience in the 1960s. I exist in a world that enjoys more equality between men and women. But I don't take any of that into my performance. I just want to play the character as who she is as an individual - scene to scene.
AUTHOR: Elizabeth Moss

QUOTE: Martin Luther King, Jr. didn't carry just a piece of cloth to symbolize his belief in racial equality he carried the American flag.
AUTHOR: Adrian Cronauer

QUOTE: At a time when efforts are being made to eradicate discrimination between the sexes in the search for social equality and justice, the differences between the sexes are being rediscovered.
AUTHOR: Carol Gilligan

QUOTE: Martin Luther King, Jr. Day is a time to honor the greatest champion of racial equality who taught a nation - through compassion and courage - about democracy, nonviolence and racial justice.
AUTHOR: Mark Pryor

QUOTE: The right to a quality education is, I believe, the perfect path to bridge the gap between different cultures and to reconcile various civilizations. Without such a right, the values of liberty, justice and equality will have no meaning. Ignorance is by far the biggest danger and threat to humankind.
AUTHOR: Mozah bint Nasser Al Missned

QUOTE: Now they have come to the place where their faith can no longer feed on the bread of repression and violence. They ask for the bread of liberty, of public equality, and public responsibility. It must not be denied them.
AUTHOR: Mordecai Wyatt Johnson

QUOTE: The goal of the EU is to form a region of freedom, security and justice. Freedom in this connection cannot be just the freedom of the strong, but it must be combined with fraternity and equality.
AUTHOR: Tarja Halonen

QUOTE: Family law is institutionally anti-male. I've been lobbying MPs, and I'm not going to give up campaigning for equality until I get equality.
AUTHOR: Louis de Bernieres

QUOTE: The only way to ensure equality for women is to clearly declare it in our Constitution.
AUTHOR: Carolyn Maloney

QUOTE: What is being called the UN 'gender architecture' is more like a shack. Women need a bigger global house if equality is ever to become a reality.
AUTHOR: Charlotte Bunch

QUOTE: I will feel equality has arrived when we can elect to office women who are as incompetent as some of the men who are already there.
AUTHOR: Maureen Reagan

QUOTE: The Internet is the hope of an integrated world without frontiers, a common world without controlling owners, a world of opportunities and equality. This is a utopia that we have been dreaming about and is a world in which each and every one of us are protagonists of a destiny that we have in our hands.
AUTHOR: Laura Chinchilla

QUOTE: Think of submitting our measure to the advice of politicians! I would as soon submit the subject of the equality of a goose to a fox.
AUTHOR: Anna Howard Shaw

QUOTE: On the road to equality there is no better place for blacks to detour around American values than in forgoing its example in the treatment of its women and the organization of its family.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Holmes Norton

QUOTE: The highest political buzz word is not liberty, equality, fraternity or solidarity it is service.
AUTHOR: Arthur Hugh Clough

QUOTE: Dreams from 1991 are becoming reality. We will build good relations between nations and people. We will strive towards mutual respect and equality of every individual, sex, race and national or any other minority.
AUTHOR: Janez Drnovsek

QUOTE: Humanistic values of equality and equal rights for all nations and individuals as crystallized in the principles of the United Nations Charter are mankind's great achievements in the 20th century.
AUTHOR: Tran Duc Luong

QUOTE: The Nordic countries are leading the way on women's equality, recognizing women as equal citizens rather than commodities for sale.
AUTHOR: Johanna Siguroardottir

QUOTE: There are a lot of things that fit on a bumper sticker in terms of either liberty or equality or progress that when made more concrete just don't pan out.
AUTHOR: Laurence Tribe

QUOTE: If money, education, and honesty will not bring to me as much privilege, as much equality as they bring to any American citizen, then they are to me a curse, and not a blessing.
AUTHOR: John Hope

QUOTE: Distinctions between citizens solely because of their ancestry are by their very nature odious to a free people whose institutions are founded upon the doctrine of equality.
AUTHOR: Harlan Stone

QUOTE: The bill neither confers nor abridges the rights of anyone but simply declares that in civil rights there shall be equality among all classes of citizens and that all alike shall be subject to the same punishment.
AUTHOR: Lyman Trumbull

QUOTE: Demands for equality for women are threats to men's self-esteem and sense of sexual turf.
AUTHOR: Alice S. Rossi

QUOTE: Equality means nothing unless incorporated into the institutions.
AUTHOR: Slobodan Milosevic

QUOTE: Yugoslavia is a multinational community and it can survive only under the conditions of full equality for all nations that live in it.
AUTHOR: Slobodan Milosevic

QUOTE: Life can only be understood backwards but it must be lived forwards.
AUTHOR: Soren Kierkegaard

QUOTE: The only source of knowledge is experience.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Experience: that most brutal of teachers. But you learn, my God do you learn.
AUTHOR: C. S. Lewis

QUOTE: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: We are not human beings having a spiritual experience. We are spiritual beings having a human experience.
AUTHOR: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

QUOTE: Experience is one thing you can't get for nothing.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: Man learns through experience, and the spiritual path is full of different kinds of experiences. He will encounter many difficulties and obstacles, and they are the very experiences he needs to encourage and complete the cleansing process.
AUTHOR: Sai Baba

QUOTE: A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.
AUTHOR: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

QUOTE: Do you know the difference between education and experience? Education is when you read the fine print experience is what you get when you don't.
AUTHOR: Pete Seeger

QUOTE: Human beings, who are almost unique in having the ability to learn from the experience of others, are also remarkable for their apparent disinclination to do so.
AUTHOR: Douglas Adams

QUOTE: The years teach much which the days never know.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
AUTHOR: Ralph Marston

QUOTE: Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.
AUTHOR: John W. Gardner

QUOTE: A woman's life can really be a succession of lives, each revolving around some emotionally compelling situation or challenge, and each marked off by some intense experience.
AUTHOR: Wallis Simpson

QUOTE: I made decisions that I regret, and I took them as learning experiences... I'm human, not perfect, like anybody else.
AUTHOR: Queen Latifah

QUOTE: You cannot create experience. You must undergo it.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: Everything has been said before, but since nobody listens we have to keep going back and beginning all over again.
AUTHOR: Andre Gide

QUOTE: When you have really exhausted an experience you always reverence and love it.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: Nothing ever becomes real till it is experienced.
AUTHOR: John Keats

QUOTE: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
AUTHOR: Auguste Rodin

QUOTE: Experience is the teacher of all things.
AUTHOR: Julius Caesar

QUOTE: If we could sell our experiences for what they cost us, we'd all be millionaires.
AUTHOR: Abigail Van Buren

QUOTE: Experience teaches only the teachable.
AUTHOR: Aldous Huxley

QUOTE: Experience enables you to recognize a mistake when you make it again.
AUTHOR: Franklin P. Jones

QUOTE: Bitter experience has taught us how fundamental our values are and how great the mission they represent.
AUTHOR: Jan Peter Balkenende

QUOTE: Experience - the wisdom that enables us to recognise in an undesirable old acquaintance the folly that we have already embraced.
AUTHOR: Ambrose Bierce

QUOTE: Conviction without experience makes for harshness.
AUTHOR: Flannery O'Connor

QUOTE: Life is like playing a violin solo in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.
AUTHOR: Samuel Butler

QUOTE: Experience without theory is blind, but theory without experience is mere intellectual play.
AUTHOR: Immanuel Kant

QUOTE: Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.
AUTHOR: Rita Mae Brown

QUOTE: Experience is the child of thought, and thought is the child of action.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: Deep experience is never peaceful.
AUTHOR: Henry James

QUOTE: Experience is a good school. But the fees are high.
AUTHOR: Heinrich Heine

QUOTE: All experience is an arch wherethrough gleams that untravelled world whose margin fades for ever and for ever when I move.
AUTHOR: Alfred Lord Tennyson

QUOTE: Skill is the unified force of experience, intellect and passion in their operation.
AUTHOR: John Ruskin

QUOTE: All that I know I learned after I was thirty.
AUTHOR: Georges Clemenceau

QUOTE: Every moment is an experience.
AUTHOR: Jake Roberts

QUOTE: Good judgment comes from experience and experience comes from bad judgment.
AUTHOR: Fred Brooks

QUOTE: There's a beauty to wisdom and experience that cannot be faked. It's impossible to be mature without having lived.
AUTHOR: Amy Grant

QUOTE: There are many truths of which the full meaning cannot be realized until personal experience has brought it home.
AUTHOR: John Stuart Mill

QUOTE: What one has not experienced, one will never understand in print.
AUTHOR: Isadora Duncan

QUOTE: The sky is the limit. You never have the same experience twice.
AUTHOR: Frank McCourt

QUOTE: The experience of God, or in any case the possibility of experiencing God, is innate.
AUTHOR: Alice Walker

QUOTE: The value of experience is not in seeing much, but in seeing wisely.
AUTHOR: William Osler

QUOTE: We are each responsible for all of our experiences.
AUTHOR: Louise L. Hay

QUOTE: There is nothing so easy to learn as experience and nothing so hard to apply.
AUTHOR: Josh Billings

QUOTE: My path has not been determined. I shall have more experiences and pass many more milestones.
AUTHOR: Agnetha Faltskog

QUOTE: My experiences have taught me a lot and I'm happy with my learnings, if not with what I went through to learn.
AUTHOR: Ally Sheedy

QUOTE: An optimist is a guy that has never had much experience.
AUTHOR: Don Marquis

QUOTE: Real love is a permanently self-enlarging experience.
AUTHOR: M. Scott Peck

QUOTE: Experience has taught me, when I am shaving of a morning, to keep watch over my thoughts, because, if a line of poetry strays into my memory, my skin bristles so that the razor ceases to act.
AUTHOR: A. E. Housman

QUOTE: Your experiences will be yours alone. But truth and best friendship will rarely if ever disappoint you.
AUTHOR: Anne Lamott

QUOTE: Experience is the only prophecy of wise men.
AUTHOR: Alphonse de Lamartine

QUOTE: Experience is a great teacher.
AUTHOR: John Legend

QUOTE: Experience comprises illusions lost, rather than wisdom gained.
AUTHOR: Joseph Roux

QUOTE: All experience is an arch, to build upon.
AUTHOR: Henry Adams

QUOTE: Experiences are savings which a miser puts aside. Wisdom is an inheritance which a wastrel cannot exhaust.

QUOTE: Few people even scratch the surface, much less exhaust the contemplation of their own experience.
AUTHOR: Randolph Bourne

QUOTE: The main thing experience has taught me is that one has to sort of hone their relationship to time, you know.
AUTHOR: John Frusciante

QUOTE: I think we are a product of all our experiences.
AUTHOR: Sanford I. Weill

QUOTE: Information's pretty thin stuff unless mixed with experience.
AUTHOR: Clarence Day

QUOTE: Most of the images of reality on which we base our actions are really based on vicarious experience.

QUOTE: Everything is discursive opinion instead of direct experience.
AUTHOR: A. R. Ammons

QUOTE: Nothing which has entered into our experience is ever lost.
AUTHOR: William Ellery Channing

QUOTE: Color is an intense experience on its own.
AUTHOR: Jim Hodges

QUOTE: Judgment comes from experience - and experience comes from bad judgment.
AUTHOR: Walter Wriston

QUOTE: Not the fruit of experience, but experience itself, is the end.
AUTHOR: Walter Pater

QUOTE: Experience is not what happens to you it's what you do with what happens to you.
AUTHOR: Aldous Huxley

QUOTE: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest Second, by imitation, which is easiest and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
AUTHOR: Confucius

QUOTE: One thorn of experience is worth a whole wilderness of warning.
AUTHOR: James Russell Lowell

QUOTE: We gain strength, and courage, and confidence by each experience in which we really stop to look fear in the face... we must do that which we think we cannot.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.'
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
AUTHOR: Helen Keller

QUOTE: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.

QUOTE: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Experience hath shewn, that even under the best forms of government those entrusted with power have, in time, and by slow operations, perverted it into tyranny.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude.
AUTHOR: Denis Waitley

QUOTE: It was the experience of mystery - even if mixed with fear - that engendered religion.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: Experience demands that man is the only animal which devours his own kind, for I can apply no milder term to the general prey of the rich on the poor.

QUOTE: Let us with caution indulge the supposition that morality can be maintained without religion. Reason and experience both forbid us to expect that national morality can prevail in exclusion of religious principle.

QUOTE: I believe that anyone can conquer fear by doing the things he fears to do, provided he keeps doing them until he gets a record of successful experience behind him.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: I don't believe people are looking for the meaning of life as much as they are looking for the experience of being alive.
AUTHOR: Joseph Campbell

QUOTE: Like success, failure is many things to many people. With Positive Mental Attitude, failure is a learning experience, a rung on the ladder, a plateau at which to get your thoughts in order and prepare to try again.

QUOTE: If money is your hope for independence you will never have it. The only real security that a man will have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience, and ability.

QUOTE: Beliefs have the power to create and the power to destroy. Human beings have the awesome ability to take any experience of their lives and create a meaning that disempowers them or one that can literally save their lives.
AUTHOR: Tony Robbins

QUOTE: The marvelous richness of human experience would lose something of rewarding joy if there were no limitations to overcome. The hilltop hour would not be half so wonderful if there were no dark valleys to traverse.
AUTHOR: Helen Keller

QUOTE: Many people know so little about what is beyond their short range of experience. They look within themselves - and find nothing! Therefore they conclude that there is nothing outside themselves either.
AUTHOR: Helen Keller

QUOTE: Never, never and never again shall it be that this beautiful land will again experience the oppression of one by another.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: I had rather have a fool to make me merry than experience to make me sad and to travel for it too!
AUTHOR: William Shakespeare

QUOTE: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.

QUOTE: If history repeats itself, and the unexpected always happens, how incapable must Man be of learning from experience.

QUOTE: Experience teaches us that it is much easier to prevent an enemy from posting themselves than it is to dislodge them after they have got possession.

QUOTE: My experience has been that work is almost the best way to pull oneself out of the depths.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: Unwearied ceaseless effort is the price that must be paid for turning faith into a rich infallible experience.

QUOTE: Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.

QUOTE: I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death.

QUOTE: I am a woman in process. I'm just trying like everybody else. I try to take every conflict, every experience, and learn from it. Life is never dull.

QUOTE: Experience keeps a dear school, but fools will learn in no other.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Franklin

QUOTE: Fame will go by and, so long, I've had you, fame. If it goes by, I've always known it was fickle. So at least it's something I experience, but that's not where I live.

QUOTE: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.

QUOTE: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.
AUTHOR: Confucius

QUOTE: I probably hold the distinction of being one movie star who, by all laws of logic, should never have made it. At each stage of my career, I lacked the experience.

QUOTE: Sex without love is a meaningless experience, but as far as meaningless experiences go its pretty damn good.
AUTHOR: Woody Allen

QUOTE: A lot of people in our industry haven't had very diverse experiences. So they don't have enough dots to connect, and they end up with very linear solutions without a broad perspective on the problem. The broader one's understanding of the human experience, the better design we will have.

QUOTE: It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it.
AUTHOR: John Steinbeck

QUOTE: The wise are instructed by reason, average minds by experience, the stupid by necessity and the brute by instinct.
AUTHOR: Marcus Tullius Cicero

QUOTE: Experience, as a desire for experience, does not come off. We must not study ourselves while having an experience.

QUOTE: To use the same words is not a sufficient guarantee of understanding one must use the same words for the same genus of inward experience ultimately one must have one's experiences in common.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: Experience has shown, and a true philosophy will always show, that a vast, perhaps the larger portion of the truth arises from the seemingly irrelevant.
AUTHOR: Edgar Allan Poe

QUOTE: Wealth is the ability to fully experience life.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: What each must seek in his life never was on land or sea. It is something out of his own unique potentiality for experience, something that never has been and never could have been experienced by anyone else.

QUOTE: I have but one lamp by which my feet are guided, and that is the lamp of experience.
AUTHOR: Patrick Henry

QUOTE: Genius is the ability to renew one's emotions in daily experience.

QUOTE: Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment.
